Name: Auckland
Description: A major urban region, Auckland is known for its diverse culture, large harbor, and being New Zealand s largest city.

Name: Bay of Plenty
Description: A coastal region known for its beautiful beaches, warm climate, and the city of Tauranga.

Name: Canterbury
Description: A region centered around Christchurch, known for its agricultural industries and the Southern Alps.

Name: Gisborne
Description: A rural region on the North Island, known for its vineyards, agriculture, and being the first city to see the sunrise.

Name: Hawke s Bay
Description: A region on the east coast, famous for its wine production, agriculture, and coastal scenery.

Name: Manawatu-Wanganui
Description: A central region known for its agriculture, particularly dairy and sheep farming.

Name: Marlborough
Description: Famous for its wine production, especially Sauvignon Blanc, and its stunning Marlborough Sounds.

Name: Nelson
Description: A small region known for its sunny climate, outdoor lifestyle, and being the center of New Zealand s arts and crafts.

Name: Northland
Description: A coastal region with beautiful beaches and a rich history, including the location of the Waitangi Treaty Grounds.

Name: Otago
Description: A southern region known for its spectacular landscapes, including mountains, lakes, and the city of Dunedin.

Name: Southland
Description: A rural, southernmost region known for its outdoor recreation, rugged coastline, and farming.

Name: Taranaki
Description: Known for the majestic Mount Taranaki, the region is famous for its dairy industry and vibrant arts scene.

Name: Waikato
Description: A large region with a focus on agriculture, known for its dairy farms and the Hobbiton movie set.

Name: Wellington
Description: The capital city region of New Zealand, known for its vibrant arts scene, government institutions, and stunning harbor views.

Name: West Coast
Description: A remote region known for its rugged coastline, rainforests, and the famous Franz Josef Glacier.
